intro: Pleroma clidemioides, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid and salty conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
